Hi all.
I'm working on a web app that integrates with HubSpot. I've created a private app to this end, and I would like to publish certain activities on the timeline of a company or contact when events happen in the web app.

I'm trying to follow this documentation page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline> but quickly running into trouble because I cannot add Event Templates to my app (the page looks different from the screenshots in this documentation).

Might this be a difference between public and private apps? But surely I am able to post events to the timeline when using a private app?

Thanks in advance for any help!
Hey Harmen, you guessed correctly. Timeline events are only supported with Public Apps currently

Hmm, what would you advice in this case?
I don't want other parties to interact with my organization's HubSpot account!

Hi all,
in my company we <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/object-settings/customize-the-middle-column-of-records|customized the middle column> of the deals to show some property lists.
From a BI perspective I'd like to load the columns referenced in the property lists, therefore I tried to fetch the config of the customizations.
But I couldn't figure out the correct endpoint / can't find anything in the developer docs to it, do you know if it's possible to fetch the config via api to extract the property names. Or should I manual write down the names and hope the default view isn't adjusted to often?
You can still use a public app and not publish it to the marketplace. You can control which portals have access to the install url.
Properly configuring the App scopes will also control what data is available
Gotcha, thanks, I will explore that route.

It will be strictly server-to-server communication.
Is that possible with HubSpot's OAuth implementation?
yes
(e.g. store a token indefinitely, and not require a round-trip for authentication)
Alright, that sounds good.
Oh sorry, I was referring to the data only integration. You will still need to manage tokens and refresh accordingly.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
Hmm, so long as I can request a token programmatically and use that for subsequent requests.
I will read up on it, thanks. :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks for the swift help so far!

<@U06R1D0LEBF> we fear that it might change any data internally. Is that the case?

From whatever technical knowledge I have post requests are generally for writing data not fetching data, hence the concern

Hi all,

I apologize for the trivial question, but I'm trying to extract as much of the activity history from a record via a ContactID that I can. I believe this should be done through the engagements API but I can't seem to get the endpoints correct. I'm using a private app that should have permissions and I'm not having any trouble with the v1 API, but some v3 API endpoints are giving me trouble.

```headers = {
    'Authorization': f'Bearer {access_token}',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

contact_id = 'XXXXX'
associations_url = f'<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{contact_id}/associations/notes>'```
For example, this fails. The documentation still has examples that use Hapikey some I'm not sure if my URL is off my understanding of associations and objects is off. I'm getting a 404 Not Found.

This works:
```headers = {
        'Authorization': f'Bearer {at}',
        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
    }

api_url = '<https://api.hubapi.com/events/v3/events/?objectType=contact&objectId=XXXXX>'```
So and I have been able to make many other calls using the API so I know the app is set up find.

Thanks

Hey all, does anyone know if there was a change in requirements for the DateTime property creation via API? I keep getting this error
```{"status":"error","message":"Property failed validation.","correlationId":"ee09d874-9fb1-4fec-a44f-c8df96fdc47f","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","subCategory":"Properties.PROPERTY_CREATE_FAILED_VALIDATION"}```
And it seems others are getting it as well - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Error-when-posting-creating-datetime-property-HTTP-400-error/m-p/951099>
Solved the issue, I just left the reference object type and calculation formula empty

<@U06V6T5D03Y> I understand your concern, but here the interface is a POST request because it expects a payload of the information required to build up the internal request (i.e. a potentially long list of Ids). It won't change any data and the documentation is quite clear what this endpoint is for.
